title: Printing or asserting in device-side code can reduce or prevent concurrency
body_html:
The problem:

  • PyTorch has asserts in its kernels. These asserts, even if not triggered, can prevent these kernels from running concurrently with other kernels.

The severity of this issue depends on the CUDA driver, but all recent drivers have some performance degradation when attempting to use kernels with asserts (or prints) in them concurrently.

In addition to the performance hit, the unexpected failure to run kernels concurrently may cause serious user and developer headaches.

Possible solutions:

  • Remove asserts and prints from device code.
  • Only enable asserts and prints for special debug builds.
